intro: Cercis yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan redbud, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. The bark is smooth and reddish-brown, adding to its visual appeal throughout the year.
